summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel B) will convene on March 20, 2024, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning and adjustment requests from residents and to facilitate public input.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, a public hearing for testimony, and the approval of minutes from the previous meeting. The Board will review uncontested items, holdover items, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals under consideration include multiple requests for special exceptions and variances related to zoning regulations. Notable cases involve requests for exceptions to single-family use regulations, fence height and opacity regulations, and variances for floor area ratio and building height.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the February 21, 2024 meeting and will deliberate on several individual cases, including requests for variances and special exceptions. Decisions will be made regarding the applications presented, which may impact zoning regulations and property use in the Dallas area. Public testimony will be taken into account before final decisions are rendered.
